title: ERROR in loading the NUMENTA data set
body:
It's used:
Ubuntu 18.04
Python 3.6.8 

I am trying to run CLI as loudml -e "load-nab -f now-30d numenta" with different parameters for -f
and am getting the following error:

  0%|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | 0/35 [00:00<?, ?it/s]Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/loudml", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/loudml_py/cli.py", line 1423, in main
    shell_args.exec(shell_args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/loudml_py/cli.py", line 1243, in exec
    from_date=args.from_date)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/loudml_py/nab.py", line 106, in load_nab
    p.imap(load, range(len(g_urls))), total=len(g_urls)))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/tqdm/std.py", line 1081, in __iter__
    for obj in iterable:
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 735, in next
    raise value
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 424, in _handle_tasks
    put(task)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/connection.py", line 206, in send
    self._send_bytes(_ForkingPickler.dumps(obj))
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/reduction.py", line 51, in dumps
    cls(buf, protocol).dump(obj)
TypeError: can't pickle _thread.lock objects
  0%|   
  
  Thanks.
